meanings.definition: Superlative form of 'drouthy', meaning extremely thirsty or dry.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, he was the drouthiest he had ever been.
meanings.sent2: The desert is known for being one of the drouthiest places on Earth.
meanings.sent3: The cactus joked that it was the drouthiest plant in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her throat felt like the drouthiest desert when she woke up.
meanings.sent5: The cracked earth was the drouthiest sight he had ever seen.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of 'drouthy', meaning most lacking in moisture or rainfall.
meanings.sent1: The drouthiest regions of the country often face water shortages.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's fields were the drouthiest in the entire valley.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella felt useless in the drouthiest storm of the season.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was the drouthiest after spending hours in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The drouthiest year on record left the reservoirs nearly empty.
